**Objectives**

This course aims at preparing students to do continuing professional development (CPD) as well as stimulating deeper understanding of the professionalism of being a teacher. In order to equip students with abilities to achieve better in this fast-changing world, education professionals can no longer teach knowledge but have to infuse high order thinking skills such as critical thinking and systems thinking in their teaching. Viewing the educational reforms, this course will guide students to achieve two major objectives. First, students will develop growth mindsets through experiencing the ways how teachers empower themselves with resources accessible. Second, students will build up their knowledge and capacity to design and teach subject content in English or bilingual modes.

**Grade Distribution**

Category

Weighting

Description

Classroom Observation

20%

You will need to observe at least 1 class session and write a reflective journal (800 words max.). Dates for the open classroom sessions will be offered.

Sharing a Book

20%

Students of 3-4 ppl from different disciplines select a book from the reading list in below or after discussing with the instructor. Each group needs to lead a 1hr workshop, helping other teams to learn what is worth pursued in the future teaching and learning. That is, related learning activities including inquiry questions or some other learning materials need to be prepared. Your performance will be evaluated by other groups and the instructor

TOK Performance

10%

Your performances in class and Moodle for TOK sessions are necessary.

BE Lesson Plan

10%

Students will create a lesson plan for a topic in their discipline. The lesson will exhibit principles of IB lesson planning learned in previous courses while incorporating principles of a flexible multiplicity BE arrangement learned in this course.  

BE Assessment

10%

Students will create a summative assessment to accompany their lesson plan. The assessment will contain items along the content–language continuum and be appropriate for a flexible multiplicity BE arrangement.

BE Material Example

5%

Students will create materials for supporting bilingual academic literacy development in their discipline. The materials should target both reading and writing for learners at various language proficiency levels.

Final BE Portfolio & Presentation

25%

Students will create a final BE portfolio based on topics covered throughout the course. Students are encouraged to compile each section of the portfolio after each class. At the end of the semester, students will present their portfolios to the class.

grading.note: Sharing a book：You need to read a book that is related to educational leadership, pedagogy inquiry, or professional development. The book list will be offered. You will need to 1) write a 500-word book introduction, 2) post the introduction to the Moodle, 3) initiates the discussion with 3 questions and respond to each peer’s discussion thread, and 4) 1500-word short essay explaining how it inspires you or how you will apply that to your future teaching.

Case Study：Each group needs to choose at least one PLC as their case study. They need to participate 3 meetings of the case PLC and take necessary field notes. Students also need to interview the PLC members with self-designed interview questions. Findings of how the PLC operates and key factors for successful PD need to be presented and each group needs to design and lead related discussions.
Personal CPD plan：Individual student needs to design their personal CPD plan.
